item.title: Java - removing leading zeroes from a string
item.description: Using Regular Expressions (regex) String str = "00938"; System.out.println("*" + str.replaceFirst("^0+", "") + "*"); //*938* Suppose the string contains only zeroes, then the output will be a null string. String str = "0000000"; System.out.println("*" + str.replaceFirst("^0+", "") + "*"); //** If you want a zero to remain in the above case use another form - String str = "0000000"; System.out.println("*" + str.replaceFirst("^0+(?!$)", "") + "*"); //*0* The negative lookahead (?
